DataElement.preferredName: Progressive Disease Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical trial that are related to disease that is increasing in scope or severity after the administration of therapeutic agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Progressive Disease Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Property.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient experienced disea
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient experienced disease progression during or within 4 months after the last dose of chemotherapy for metastatic disease, or during or within 6 months after the last dose of adjuvant chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received one to three lines of therapy for their disease with lines of therapy being separated by the presence of documented disease progression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has colorectal cancer (Cohort 2) has patient progressed following greater than or equal to 1 first line chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has colorectal cancer (Cohort 2) has patient progressed following greater than or equal one-line chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have WHO grade III or IV glioma and progressive disease greater than or equal to 12 weeks after completion chemoradiotherapy as defined by: New contrast-enhancing lesion outside of radiation field on decreasing, stable, or increasing doses of corticosteroids; Increase by greater than or equal to 25% in the sum of the products of perpendicular diameters between the first post-radiotherapy scan, or a subsequent scan with smaller tumor size, and the scan at 12 weeks or later on stable or increasing doses of corticosteroids; For patients receiving antiangiogenic therapy, significant increase in T2/FLAIR non-enhancing lesion may also be considered progressive disease. The increased T2/FLAIR must have occurred with the patient on stable or increasing doses of corticosteroids compared with baseline scan or best response after initiation of therapy and not be a result of comorbid events (e.g., effects of radiation therapy, demyelination, ischemic injury, infection, seizures, postoperative changes, or other treatment effects)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have WHO grade III or IV glioma and progressive disease greater than or equal to 12 weeks after completion chemoradiotherapy? Progression can be defined by: New contrast-enhancing lesion outside of radiation field on decreasing, stable, or increasing doses of corticosteroids; Increase by greater than or equal to 25% in the sum of the products of perpendicular diameters between the first post-radiotherapy scan, or a subsequent scan with smaller tumor size, and the scan at 12 weeks or later on stable or increasing doses of corticosteroids; For patients receiving antiangiogenic therapy, significant increase in T2/FLAIR non-enhancing lesion may also be considered progressive disease. The increased T2/FLAIR must have occurred with the patient on stable or increasing doses of corticosteroids compared with baseline scan or best response after initiation of therapy and not be a result of comorbid events (e.g., effects of radiation therapy, demyelination, ischemic injury, infection, seizures, postoperative changes, or other treatment effects)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient experienced disease progression during or within 4 months after the last dose of chemotherapy for metastatic disease, during or within 6 months after the last dose of adjuvant chemotherapy, or has been intolerant of previous chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has colorectal cancer (Cohort 2) has patient progressed following greater than or equal to one-line chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease progression on or after platinum-based chemotherapy for metastatic disease or within 6 months of completion of platinum-based chemotherapy administration as adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy or concurrent chemoradiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has disease progressed after abiraterone, enzalutamide, docetaxel, or other secondary hormonal therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If enrolled in the Phase 1b/Safety Run-in, is patient eligible to receive induction chemotherapy with taxane+trastuzumab+pertuzumab as mentioned in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has autoimmune or other conditions where PD-(L)1 checkpoint inhibitors are contraindicated, has patient progressed on or after platinum-based chemotherapy or immunotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the dose expansion Cohort A (intrinsic resistance), has patient had prior treatment with PARP inhibitors, disease progression per RECIST at 1st re-staging, and germline or somatic mutations in BRCA1 or BRCA2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have progressive or recurrent disease after having been treated with at least one  tumor-directed therapy prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient experienced disease progression within 6 months (180 days) of initiating treatment with a PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed on or after at least one line of standard-of-care (SOC) intervention, except for those patients without SOC or for whom talazoparib is SOC?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed on at least first-line therapy for metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has disease progressed after abiraterone, enzalutamide, apalutamide, darolutamide, or taxane chemotherapy (docetaxel, cabazitaxel)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, did patient previously progress on immunotherapy with dinutuximab or other anti-GD2 monoclonal antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with Hu5F9-G4 (magrolimab) or any agent targeting CD47-SIRPa or prior progression of disease with mogamulizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed following at least one standard prior chemotherapy regimen with the exception of SDH-deficient GIST for which there is no standard of care?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab plus bevacizumab arm and has progressed on P10005 atezolizumab monotherapy, are the following requirements and all other selection criteria met: No prior disease progression on an immune checkpoint inhibitor plus tyrosine kinase inhibitor combination therapy, any prior toxicities have resolved to eligibility levels and no contraindications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has disease progressed after at least one of the following: abiraterone, enzalutamide, apalutamide, darolutamide, or taxane chemotherapy (docetaxel, cabazitaxel)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had disease progression during or following treatment with at least one platinum-containing regimen (e.g., GC, MVAC, Carbo-Gem) and an immune checkpoint inhibitor (PD-1/ PD-L1 inhibitor including, but not limited to: atezolizumab, pembrolizumab, durvalumab, avelumab, and nivolumab)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed on at least one prior standard therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient had radiological progression per RECIST 1.1 after prior PRRT treatment and no sooner than 12 months from last scan performed post completion of initial PRRT where either stable disease, partial response, or complete response has been maintained throughout.

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 12/21/22 added AQT and alt OID, CCTG for ticket number CADSR0001818 cjl.
